skse.name: Skyrim Script Extender
skse.description: Main tool similar to the Nexus Mod Manager (NMM) but much more advanced
note-more: This mod requires a special install:
Place *.exe and *.dll into <skyrim>/ (not the data directory!)
Repackage skse*.zip:
Extract Data/
Repackage into a new zip file (name it accordingly)
Place into MO downloads directory
Install repacked archive via MO
Add the following to skyrim\Data\SKSE\skse.ini (create INI if necessary):
General
ClearInvalidRegistrations=1

cell-stabilizer.name: Stable uGridsToLoad
cell-stabilizer.description: This allows you to use higher uGridsToLoad settings

enboost.name: ENBoost
note-more: REMEMBER: Set iPresentInterval=0 in SkyrimPrefs.ini (See STEP:Guide INI Tweaks)
Follow these steps to install ENBoost
Download the latest ENB binary. STEP does not recommend downloading the Skyrim Nexus version of ENBoost due to incorrect settings for STEP.
The links at the bottom of the page list all the binaries. Choose the latest file (usually the one on the top of the list), then on the next page click the Down1.gif button.
Open the ENB binary archive and go to the "WrapperVersion" folder, then extract only d3d9.dll, enbhost.exe, and enblocal.ini to the <Skyrim>/ directory -- NOT <Skyrim>/Data.
Open enblocal.ini in Notepad++ or similar text editor.

Find the section named [GLOBAL] and set UsePatchSpeedhackWithoutGraphics=true (disables the enbseries.ini graphic effects that are most typical of ENB but allow the memory management and basic graphics tweaks contained within enblocal.ini).
Find the section marked [MEMORY] and ...
Change parameters according to your video card.
Set VideoMemorySizeMb= (yes, this should be blank)
Set AutodetectVideoMemorySize=true (sets the proper VRAM allocation automatically)
Find the section marked [ENGINE] and ...
Set EnableVSync=true (eliminates screen tearing at high FPS by enabling vsync does not harm/hinder anything if frame rates are < 60 FPS)
Set VSyncSkipNumFrames=0 (tells the frame buffer to ignore the back buffer 0, 1, 2, or 3 contiguous cycles before grabbing a frame, which rarely if ever applies)
Save and close.
Optional - Enable Windowed Mode
This may be necessary as a performance enhancement for some users. Under [WINDOW] ...
Set ForceBorderless=true
Set ForceBorderlessFullscreen=true
Test either/both settings independently or together to see if this helps with performance.

borderless-windows.name: Borderless Window
borderless-windows.note: ENBoost users should not use this mod, since there is borderless window options included in ENBoost. Recommended for Performance STEP or for users of AMD/ATI cards.
